meta.name: Mugshot Design System (Implementation Spec)
meta.description: Implementation-focused design system and guidelines for Mugshot — a journaling social app to rate cafes and the drinks you order. Optimized so AI can extend Mugshot with new screens and components while preserving the existing mint, card-based, iOS-native aesthetic.

visualStyle: Soft, friendly, approachable: rounded cards, generous white space, and subtle elevation instead of harsh borders.
Calm, low-noise palette: most surfaces are white or very light gray with mint and blue accents used sparingly.
Content-first coffee journaling: photos, ratings, and visit logs are the hero; chrome stays quiet and supportive.
iOS-native feel: system typography, familiar navigation patterns, and spacing that matches iOS Human Interface Guidelines.
Consistent card grammar: nearly all content (logs, stats, lists, profiles) sits inside rounded cards or structured sections with clear titles.
interaction: Primary actions use a full-width mint filled button with strong clarity and enough vertical padding.
State changes (selected, active, disabled) rely on color, subtle fills, and occasional elevation; avoid heavy borders.
Animations are gentle and purposeful (e.g., segmented control selection, button presses) — no playful bounces.
Tap targets must be comfortable: minimum 44x44 pt with sufficient spacing between interactive elements.
Scrolling is primarily vertical on most screens, with clear sections and consistent padding.
layout: Single-column, vertical scroll: content is stacked in sections with section headers and cards.
Top header (app bar) defines the page identity; filters and controls live just below it.
Use system-aligned page padding so content never touches the screen edges.
Use grids for metrics when showing more than two stats to keep structure predictable.
dataVisualization: Prefer simple stat tiles and badges over complex charts.
Use color sparingly to indicate positive or negative change; do not rely on color alone (include labels like '+12.5%').
Key metrics like average rating, total visits, and beverage mix should be immediately scannable: larger numbers, smaller supporting labels and subtitles.

usageNotes: Use mintMain as the primary accent for filled buttons and major positive highlights.
Use mintLight for page headers and soft top sections to create a branded band behind the title.
Use blueAccent for secondary emphasis such as score badges or non-primary CTAs.
Screen background must always use neutralBackground so that white cards are visually elevated.
Avoid pure black; all default text must use textPrimary, textSecondary, or textTertiary.
Dividers and borders should remain subtle and low-contrast using neutralDivider or neutralBorder.

fontFamilies.primary: System UI (SF Pro Text on iOS)

usageNotes: Use sentence case for almost all text (e.g., 'View full analytics', not 'VIEW FULL ANALYTICS').
Screen titles should be bold and left-aligned.
Use caption styles for small metadata labels and uppercased stat labels.
Use statNumber for key numeric metrics in tiles and summary stats.

layoutPatterns: Use 16pt pagePadding for horizontal padding on most screens.
SectionVerticalGap of 24pt is used between major sections (e.g., header, metrics, content list, platform breakdown).
Use cardPadding (16pt) for the internal padding of most cards.
Use smaller gaps (8–12pt) for spacing between inline elements inside a card.

usageNotes: Use cardSoft for primary elevated cards like the main content cards on the dashboard.
Use cardLifted sparingly for elements that need extra prominence (e.g., floating CTAs or elevated overlays).
Avoid using shadows on every element; cards should feel light, not heavy.

appBar.notes: Mint header band with status bar, screen title, and subtitle (e.g., 'Saved', 'Feed', 'Log a Visit'). Content scrolls beneath or starts just below.

dashboardPage.notes: Generic pattern for Mugshot’s stat-heavy pages such as Coffee Journey and profile analytics: header, optional filters, stat tiles grid, list-style sections, and a primary CTA. All sections use consistent horizontal padding and sectionVerticalGap spacing.

metricGrid.notes: Stat tiles are rendered in a 2-column grid with equal-width cards and equal spacing.

primary.notes: Use for primary CTAs such as 'Sign In', 'Log a Visit', 'Save Visit', or 'View mutual cafe'. Buttons are typically full-width on mobile with 16pt side padding. When disabled, use primaryAccentSoftFill and keep the label readable.

statTileCard.notes: Used for top-level metrics like Total Visits, Cafes Visited, Avg Rating, and Favorite Drink on Coffee Journey and profile screens.

baseCard.notes: Generic card container used across Mugshot for grouped content such as Content Performance-style lists, Platform Breakdown, Ratings sections, visibility choices, and coffee journey summaries.

sectionHeader.notes: Use at the top of each card or page section to label content (e.g., 'Coffee Journey', 'Saved', 'Ratings'), optionally with a short supporting subtitle.

scoreBadge.notes: Use for small numeric scores (e.g., 4.2 average rating) or summary labels that need a compact, pill-like badge on cards and profile stats.

designSegmentedControl.notes: Used for timeframe selection on the dashboard (Today, Week, Month, Year) and should be reused for similar top-of-page filters.

pillChip.notes: Used for small categorical labels like platforms or filters inside rows and cards.

contentPerformanceRow.notes: Use for listing top-performing visits, cafes, or posts in Mugshot, ensuring clear readability of the title, platform/location, and engagement-style metrics.

platformRow.notes: Used in the Platform Breakdown card to show audience distribution by platform.

creatingNewScreens: Always start by defining the primary user goal of the screen, then place the most important metric or action near the top.
Use the existing appBar style for new top-level screens, with a clear title and short descriptive subtitle.
Stack content in vertical sections separated by SectionHeader and BaseCard components.
Reuse existing components (PrimaryButton, StatTileCard, DesignSegmentedControl, PillChip, BaseCard, SectionHeader) wherever possible before inventing new patterns.
When adding new metrics, use StatTileCard for simple numeric stats and BaseCard with rows for more detailed breakdowns.
componentExtension: If a new button type is required, extend from the primary button spec by adjusting colors or borders, but keep padding, typography, and corner radius consistent.
New chips should match PillChip’s shape, typography, and border behavior; only adjust colors if representing a different semantic state.
Any new segmented controls should follow the DesignSegmentedControl container and segment specs to keep interactions consistent.
accessibility: Maintain sufficient color contrast between text and backgrounds, especially for stat labels and subtitles.
Do not rely on color alone to convey meaning: pair color changes with text labels, icons, or +/- indicators.
Ensure tap targets meet at least 44x44 pt hit area, including segmented control options and chips.
Keep text scalable by relying on the defined typography tokens rather than fixed pixel-based sizes.
